value.description: A soft, rare fruit tied to stories of divinity, ascending to the other-side, and granting the curse of immortality. Ambrosia's taste matches the myth with its heavenly texture, subtle notes of sweetness, and wild rush of mind-bending chemicals that provide a mood-increasing chemical high. However, if eaten too often, it can generate a mild addiction.
Ambrosia's chemicals pervade the bloodstream, lifting the mood but noticeably lacking in radical powers of immortality. A damned shame indeed.
Ahh, feed of the gods. It's incredibly sweet...
Because of an ambrosia addiction, this person needs to regularly consume ambrosia to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
A built-up tolerance to ambrosia. The more severe this tolerance is, the more ambrosia it takes to get the same effect.

A chemical addiction to ambrosia. Long-term presence of ambrosia has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug. \nWithout regular doses of ambrosia, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
I feel so heavy and endlessly cold. Am I being punished? Just for some fruit?
